snippet: The Obama administration was trying to address consumers’ concerns that costs were too high and that the choice of doctors, hospitals and prescription drugs was too limited.
abstract: Obama administration issues stringent new standards for health insurance to address complaints from consumers who say costs are too high and choice of doctors, hospitals and prescription drugs is too limited in many health plans offered under the Affordable Care Act; officials say they will scrutinize plans more closely for 2015.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration was trying to address consumers’ concerns that costs were too high and that the choice of doctors, hospitals and prescription drugs was too limited.

headline.main: White House Tightens Health Plan’s Standards After Consumers Complain
headline.print_headline: White House Tightens Health Plan’s Standards After Consumers Complain

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
